title: What are the disadvantages of doing an online MBA? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are a few significant disadvantages in doing an online MBA vs. a full-time residential MBA experience. Some of them are obvious. Some less so. Even if you are in a blended online program, your face-to-face engagement with both your classmates and the faculty will be limited to non-existent. In residential programs, the most significant learning experience any student receives is through this interaction. Truth is, much of the learning in an MBA program comes from the sharing of work experiences from other students. You will miss much of this—though not all—in an online environment.The more limited engagement that results in an online program also leads to another major disadvantage: the greater difficulty in creating enduring bonds with your classmates and the faculty that lets you graduate with a truly supportive and enduring network of smart, ambitious people. Yes, you will make friends in your online MBA program. But it can never be the same as spending two years with each other in a residential program.While many online MBA programs, particularly the best, offer coaching and career development services, they are not equivalent to what you would get in a residential experience where mainstream recruiters come to campus to present to and to interview students for open jobs. And the amount of one-on-one attention you would get in a residential program from coaching and mentoring programs vastly exceeds what you would tend to get in an online environment.While the stigma of an online degree is eroding, some employers may not treat your education the same way they would treat a residential experience. I think this attitude will continue to fade over time, particularly when you can explain why you chose an online option, especially if it comes from a well known school, such as IU’s Kelley program, UNC, USC, Rice, or Florida.We recently did an extensive survey of alumni from the top online MBA programs to measure their satisfaction with the experience, the results are quite telling and I think you would be interested in them: Student Satisfaction In Best Online MBAs
